conversation.content: I'm sorry, I'm just... what's the word... technologically challenged, but I have these streaming charges?
No worries at all, let me pull up your account here... hmm, I see you've got account number ACC-4892-JK3. Looks like there's multiple services, so let me break those down for you real quick.
Oh God, multiple? I thought I only had the one thing.

Okay so, um, I'm seeing three active subscriptions here. There's StreamMax at $15.99 charged on the 3rd, then MovieHub Plus for $12.99 on the 15th, and uh... let me scroll down... ShowTime Premium at $8.99 on the 22nd.
Wait, three? I don't even know what... what do you call it... ShowTime Premium is?

Right, so ShowTime Premium, that one actually got added on October 12th, transaction ID TXN-9847-PPL2. Hmm, were you maybe trying to watch something specific that day? Sometimes it asks if you want to upgrade and people click through without realizing.
October 12th? That's when my grandkids visited. Oh no, I probably did something wrong.

Ah yeah, that happens more than you'd think actually. Let me see here... good news is I can cancel that one right now if you want, and er, I can even backdate it to get you a refund for this month, credit reference CRD-3392-MM.
You can do that? Oh thank goodness. I feel so silly.

Not silly at all, seriously. Okay so I've cancelled ShowTime, processing that refund now... erm, what about MovieHub Plus? Looking at your viewing history, code VH-8829-QT5, you haven't actually used that one since September.
MovieHub? Is that the one with the... er... the purple icon thingy?

Yep, exactly, purple icon. So here's what I'm thinking—since you're not using it, we could cancel that too and save you another $12.99 monthly? Though wait, let me check something first... hmm, you do have a bundle discount BND-7745-XK on StreamMax that might change if we remove MovieHub.
Oh for heaven's sake. See, this is why I stick to books usually.

Ha, I hear you. Alright so, uh, if we keep the bundle, you're paying $24.98 total for both, but if we cancel MovieHub, StreamMax goes up to $19.99. So basically you're only saving like five bucks by dropping it.
Five dollars? That's it? Well that's... what's the term... counterintuitive.

Yeah, bundles are weird like that. Tell you what though—I'm looking at promo code SAVE30 that I could apply, expires November 30th, which would give you 30% off StreamMax for three months. Would bring your total down to about $18 monthly through February.
Okay now I'm just confused again. Sorry, can you repeat that?

No problem, let me simplify. Right now after cancelling ShowTime, you'll pay $24.98 for StreamMax and MovieHub together. With this promo I can add, order modification OM-5563-RVP, you'd pay roughly $18 total for both services through February 2025, then it goes back to regular price.
Eighteen instead of twenty-five? Yes, please do that one.

Perfect, applying that now... alright, promo code's active, confirmation number CNF-8821-QWZ2. You'll see the adjusted amount on your next billing cycle, and er, the ShowTime refund should hit your card in 3-5 business days. Anything else I can help clarify about these subscriptions?

scenario: retired teacher, patient but confused about streaming service charges she doesn't recognize
